DataElement.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Tissue Donor Three Or More HLA Mismatch Count Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes/No response that indicates the patient meets the eligibility requirement for participation in a clinical trial with regard to receiving a stem cell transplant from a donor who has three or more HLA mismatches.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Tissue Donor Three Or More HLA Mismatch Count Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another._Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Greater in size, amount, extent, or degree._The determination of the total number of mismatches between the study subject and his or her donor for the human leukocyte antigens (HLA)._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clinical treatment in which HSC capable of reconstituting the immune system and blood production (hematopoiesis) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another. The donor and recipient may or may not be related. 2005

Concepts.definition: A clinical treatment in which hematopoietic stem cells (HSCs) are transferred from one genetically dissimilar individual to another.

Property.preferredName: Tissue Donor Three Or More HLA Mismatch Count Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Greater in size, amount, extent, or degree.:The determination of the total number of mismatches between the study subject and his or her donor for the human leukocyte antigens (HLA).:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
A natural number greater than 2 and less than 4 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of two and one.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Greater in size, amount, extent, or degree.
The determination of the total number of mismatches between the study subject and his or her donor for the human leukocyte antigens (HLA).
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for study ACCL1633 Eligibility CRF. 12/20/17 AH.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
